instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges On All Ports, Turn On But No USB On Left Ports
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here. It turns on, charges battery, works perfectly except for left USB ports. They can charge battery via USB-C but no USB devices get detected on them, not even get power from USB on USB mouse or any other device. The board had corrosion near <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>/5850/3906 which I cleaned and verified traces and components surrounding, but still same behavior. Where can I start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges On All Ports, Turn On But No USB On Left Ports
threads.message:
Check all components around <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>.
L3500 must get 5V, when insert and USB device into left ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges On All Ports, Turn On But No USB On Left Ports
threads.message: <CHIP>U3500</CHIP> was bad! I was not getting 5V on L3500. Thanks for the help!
